Name: Adjust text size of the message list
Description: Have the ability to adjust the text size of the message list. Most likely  we'll keep this simple and have it follow the single "Text Size" preference that also affects the conversation view.

Name: Automatically select best From address
Description: Mimestream will now automatically select the best From address when composing a message  based on the current recipients and your past sent message history. If a From address is updated, an [Updated] label will appear besides the From address popup, to indicate that the address was automatically updated. This feature is enabled if the "Compose From" preference is set to "Automatically select best address".

Name: Favorites section in sidebar
Description: Drag your favorite labels into the favorites section in the sidebar for easier access.

Name: Apple Silicon support
Description: Mimestream is now a universal binary  ready to run natively on Apple Silicon!

Name: Share files via Mimestream (Share extension)
Description: Share files from other apps and the Finder by using the system Share menu. Just be sure to first enable Mimestream as a sharing destination (by using the "More" option inside the Share menu).

Name: Send Again / Resend
Description: Easily open a compose window  pre-populated with the contents of a message you previously sent. Great for sending status reports and other regular emails.

Name: Support macOS Focus Filters
Description: Available in macOS 13  Focus Filters allow you to configure how apps deliver you notifications for each Focus state.In Mimestream, we plan to support Focus Filters by allowing you to configure which Profile is active during each focus. That way, you can have only the "Personal" profile active during the "Personal" focus, or only the "Work" profile during the "Work" focus, etc. You won't receive notifications for accounts in other profiles while in these Focus states.

Name: Ability to hide the preview pane
Description: Add the ability to hide (and re-show) the right-hand viewing pane (conversation view) of the main window.

Name: Add addresses to Apple Contacts
Description: From an address token's context menu  an address can be directly added to Apple Contacts.

Name: Google Contacts support
Description: Full support for managing and viewing Google Contacts within Mimestream.

Name: Plain text editing
Description: Ability to compose email in plain text only.

Name: At Mentions for Recipients
Description: When replying to a thread  sometimes you need to quickly add another person. With the new @/+ mention syntax, you do this with a natural keyboard-based workflow. Just type “@First” (or “+First”) into the editor to get an autocompletion menu, and use the arrow keys to select a recipient. This will add them to the To field, and also insert a clickable link for their name.The inserted link behaves as a token. If you press delete with your cursor in front of it, the entire token is deleted. The To field automatically reacts to this change, and the address is deleted there too.

Name: Find support
Description: Easily find text within a conversation using the platform-native inline find UI.

Name: Phishing detection and sender verification
Description: Show a banner for suspicious phishing emails or emails with unverified senders. This warning can help users think twice before falling prey to scams.

Name: Sorting messages in the list
Description: Provide a way to sort messages in the list  by e.g. reversed date (newest at bottom) or sender.Note: This might sound simple, but is actually a difficult feature for Mimestream to add, so we don't expect to be adding this in the short term. Gmail's Web UI has no way to sort messages, and the specifics of the Gmail API make it difficult for us to implement this without a new, hybrid Gmail API + IMAP sync strategy.Tip: If you want to sort by sender primarily to see other messages from the same sender, a helpful tip is to click the sender's address token and then choose "Search for 'sender@example.com'".

Name: Calendar banner invitee status
Description: When displaying the calendar invitation banner  Mimestream now show the current response status of all invitees.

Name: Preference to automatically BCC an address
Description: Add a preference to automatically BCC an address when composing or replying. When voting for this  please let us know what your use-case is, and what options you'd like to see!

Name: Label or star drafts in the compose window
Description: Sometimes it's helpful to keep sent messages organized by client  project, or other attribute like a "needs follow-up" label. Or sometimes, it's helpful to star a sent message so you know to come back to it. Although labels and stars can already be added to a draft from the main window, with direct support in the compose window, it'll be a lot easier to keep things tidy!

Name: Disable conversations
Description: View messages one at a time  instead of grouped by conversation.

Name: Reply-only signatures
Description: Gmail has the ability to specify a different (often shorter) signature for use when replying to messages. Unfortunately  the Gmail API does not support this, but Mimestream can offer a client-side setting that allows a Reply-only signature to be specified.

Name: Single-line message list with columns
Description: Configure the message list to have a compact  single-line layout with columns – like the default list in Gmail.In addition, this configuration would offer a horizontal split view with the ability to display the preview pane below the list of messages.

Name: Profiles to group accounts together
Description: Easily separate work and personal data with profiles to group accounts together. Access each profile via a separate tab  or switch using an inline switcher.

Name: Labs: Snooze conversations
Description: Unfortunately  the Gmail API does not currently support snoozing. Please visit the Gmail API bug and "star" it to express your interest in this to Google.Unless this gets added, we have added a client-side snooze feature, which can be enabled from the “Labs” tab of Preferences. This will hide the message from your Inbox in Mimestream. However, the message will remain in the Inbox on Gmail's servers (and therefore be visible in the Inbox from Gmail web, Gmail iOS, and other email apps). We won't actually remove the Inbox label from the message, because we can't guarantee that Mimestream macOS will be running to unsnooze the message at the appropriate time (and we don't run servers with access to your account).Once we have a companion iOS client, and the user is using the app there, we will graduate the client-side snoozing feature from Labs, and investigate replaying the state to the server, using the more-frequently-connected iOS device as a fallback to perform the unsnooze.

Name: Customize notifications on a per-account basis
Description: Configure notification preferences on a per-account basis  and choose between Primary Inbox, Inbox, and None. This preference affects both the slide-in notifications and the dock unread acount.

Name: "Move To" menu  toolbar button, and shortcuts
Description: Additional ways to move messages (besides drag and drop)  including menus, a toolbar button, and keyboard shortcuts to be able to type (with completion) the name of the destination.

Name: Support the Important Label
Description: Support marking messages as important or not-important  and sync these values with Gmail. Add an Important folder in the sidebar to easily see all messages with this label, and add it as a criterion for the Message Filter.

Name: Ability to disable and enable accounts
Description: For some scenarios  it is convenient to be able to temporarily disable an account, rather than completely removing it from the app and having to re-add it at a later date. Some examples include: Being on vacation and wanting to temporarily shut off your work email to be able to un-plugHaving additional "junk" accounts that you don't want cluttering up your daily experience

Name: French Localization
Description: Mimestream is now localized in French – just set your system language to French in System Preferences and relaunch Mimestream to see the update.

Name: Deep linking to conversations
Description: Copy deep links to specific conversations  and use these links within other apps to be able to quickly reopen the app focused on this conversation.

Name: Configure server-side filters (rules)
Description: Manage Gmail's server-side filters for incoming messages right within Mimestream. These filters will be synced with Gmail via the API  and the filters will be run by Gmail's servers (even when Mimestream isn't running).

Name: Preference for notification actions
Description: Currently  Mimestream only presents one action button on notifications. This is either Archive or Trash, depending on what the "Delete Key" setting is in the app's Settings (on the General tab).There are other actions that might be useful: Mark Read, Report Spam, Reply, or just having both Trash and Archive available from a combined menu.Let us know what else you'd want to do from a notification!

Name: Mute conversations
Description: Unfortunately  the Gmail API doesn't support muting conversations. Please star the Gmail API bug to vote for this, but do NOT comment "+1".If Google were to add this to the public Gmail API, Mimestream would swiftly add support for muting conversations!

Name: Select and reply to a specific message in conversation view
Description: Add the concept of a selected message to the conversation view  and then be able to act specifically on that message via keyboard shortcut, toolbar button, etc. This is commonly requested in order to make it easier to reply to a specific message from the middle of the thread, but let us know if you have any other use cases for this!

Name: Manage sidebar list visibility for Labels
Description: Show or Hide labels from the sidebar  and sync these values with Gmail.

Name: Disable unified inbox (and other unified folders)
Description: For those that prefer to view their accounts completely separately  offer the ability to disable the Unified Inbox/folders.For even more customizability, look at the additional Profiles idea.

Name: Templates
Description: Templates can now be added through Preferences  and can be inserted in the compose window either by clicking the Template toolbar icon, or by using the ⌘/ keyboard shortcut.Some rudimentary variable substitution is supported: for example, to insert the first name of a recipient, include the following pattern in your template: Hi {{ recipient.first_name | 'Friend' }} (where the 'Friend' is a required fallback name if there is no recipient specified yet). Please let us know what other variables you'd like to see supported!Unfortunately, the Gmail API does not expose Gmail's internal templates feature, so templates you've created in Mimestream do not sync with Gmail (and vice versa). If you haven't already, please star the Gmail API issue at: https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/174678306 in order to help express your desire for this functionality to Google. If the Gmail API added this capability, Mimestream would be able to then sync with Gmail.

Name: Search field tokens
Description: Easily construct complex search queries by using search field tokens. When typing into the search field  a suggestions menu will appear, allowing selection of a search term that will turn into a token in the search field. The token's label can be clicked, revealing a menu that allows you to change the search type for that token (e.g. switching "From" to "To" for an address token). Mimestream 0.23.0 supports a variety of tokens in the search field, such as addresses, subjects, labels, message attributes (starred, unread, important), and attachments (has attachment, has presentation, has document, has spreadsheet, has Google Drive link, etc).

Name: Resize images with corner drag handles
Description: Mimestream already supports resizing images with a popup that lets you choose from a list of sizes: Original  Large, Medium, and Small. However, in some scenarios it may be useful to have corner drag handles and resize an image to an exact size, rather than choosing a predefined size.

Name: Markdown substitutions
Description: Style your text with markdown commands and have them be substituted with the appropriately formatted text. If desired  this feature can be disabled from the Edit > Substitutions > Markdown feature. Supported substitutions include:Bold, Italic, and Bold+Italic formatting (single, double, or triple stars)Quote blocks by starting a line with > Inline code with a single backtick & code blocks with three backticksBulleted lists, dashed lists, and numbered listsNon-substitution-based markdown editing support (with a preview panel) is still under consideration – see Markdown support.

Name: Inline message translation
Description: Add ability to translate messages inline.Note that Mimestream already has some support for translation functionality. Select the text you wish to translate (or press ⌘A with focus inside a message body to select-all)   and from the context menu choose "Translate".

Name: Add preference for default composing font
Description: Choose the default font to be automatically used when composing email. This font would be encoded into any sent messages and seen by the recipient.Note: Mimestream does have a text size preference  which will increase the font size for your own viewing purposes, but not affect the contents of the sent message.

Name: Accept or decline calendar invitations
Description: Easily accept or decline invitations directly from invitation messages.

Name: Custom Inbox Categories / Splits
Description: Although Gmail supports Inbox categories like "Promotions" and "Social" out-of-the box  there are cases where it might be useful to define your own Inbox categories and separate those messages out of your Primary Inbox. In particular, if you receive notification messages from a third-party system that require your attention, and you like to archive them to mark them as "done", this may be handy.

Name: Multiple tabs in the main window
Description: Easily work with multiple tabs and view different sets of mail at the same time  without losing your place.

Name: Support "New" count for categorized inboxes
Description: Instead of seeing an unread count for your categorized inboxes  see the number of new unread messages since the last time you checked it.

Name: Autocomplete addresses from the Workspace Directory
Description: Improve autocomplete suggestions by querying the Google Workspace Directory  so you can easily send email to other people at your company that you haven't emailed before.

Name: Support the JMAP protocol (e.g. Fastmail)
Description: Support the JMAP protocol and allow adding accounts from service providers that support it (e.g. Fastmail).

Name: Send large attachments via Google Drive
Description: When attachments are over 25MB and cannot be sent directly directly attached to the message  offer to send the attachment as a Drive link. Additionally, offer inserting attachments from Drive.

Name: Integrate with Google "Other Contacts"
Description: Google Contacts has an "Other Contacts" list that contains all addresses that you've previously emailed throughout the entire history of your account. By syncing and integrating with this list  Mimestream will gain the ability to autocomplete addresses from this list, not just recently sent-to addresses.

Name: Clickable star in message list
Description: Allow clicking the star indicator in the message list to toggle the starred-ness.

Name: Swipe action options for "Label" and "Move To"
Description: Message list row swipe actions can now be configured to be "Label" or "Move to". See Preferences > Message List.

Name: Scheduled hours for notifications
Description: When you have work and personal accounts together in the same app  disconnecting from work can be tough when the notifications keep rolling in. With scheduled hours, you could configure your "Work" notifications to automatically shut off outside of working hours.

Name: Markdown support
Description: Mimestream already supports Markdown syntax substitutions  but it would also be useful to be able to compose messages entirely in plain-text markdown, and preview the generated HTML. The markdown itself would be used for the plain text part of the message.

Name: Scheduled Send
Description: The Gmail API does not currently support this  so please star the Gmail API bug to express your desire for this functionality. If Google were to add this to the Gmail API, Mimestream would swiftly adopt support for this.Without Gmail API support, the most robust option for adding this feature is to create an opt-in service that performs the message send at the appropriate time. With any service-assisted functionality, we would have a clear and explicit opt-in process, and utilize the minimum possible scope of access to deliver the functionality requested. The Gmail API fortunately appears to offer a very narrow "gmail.send" auth scope that would allow us to build a "Mimestream Scheduled Send Service" to just send a draft based on its ID, but not see the contents of the draft (or any other message in the account).

Name: Move messages between accounts
Description: Easily select multiple conversations and move them to another account.

Name: Arrow-based keyboard navigation between panes
Description: Use the left and right arrow keys to easily move focus between the different panes in the main window. Great for quickly switching to another inbox!

Name: Option to download more (or all) messages
Description: Add a setting to explicitly control the number of days of email cached locally  or be able to cache all messages in the account locally. Currently, the exact size of the message cache on the device is the result of heuristics. Mimestream is designed to be a lightweight streaming client, which minimizes its use of disk space and enables very fast synchronization. When you scroll to the bottom of the list, additional pages of messages are automatically loaded in, and all of your messages are accessible via search.Additionally, the Gmail API is not optimized for a "download all messages" use-case, so given the practical constraints around API quota limits, so there are some technical challenges to overcome here. We have plenty of ideas on how to tackle this, but it's not as simple as just adding an option in Settings that changes a backend constant for number of days cached.

Name: Add ability to toggle between Reply and Reply All
Description: Sometimes  after starting a reply, you realize you should reply-all to include the Cc recipients (and vice versa). Add the ability to toggle between the two reply modes from an existing compose window.

Name: Scripting (and Shortcuts app) support
Description: Support scripting Mimestream via AppleScript or the Shortcuts app! Let us know specifically what actions you'd like to script  to help us prioritize what subset of scripting functionality to deliver first!

Name: Emoji substitutions
Description: Offer automatic inline emoji substitutions when writing email  like the Messages app does. This can be enabled/disabled from the main menu by toggling Edit > Substitutions > Emoji Replacement .

Name: Image resizing functionality
Description: Add the ability to pick between original  large, medium, and small image sizes before sending a message with inline image attachments.

Name: Template subjects and recipients
Description: Add header fields to templates  like a subject, or To/Cc/Bcc recipients. These will be automatically populated when inserting a template into a draft.

Name: Mimestream for Windows
Description: Build a Windows version of Mimestream. This truthfully isn't something we have planned for the foreseeable future  but maybe once we have macOS and iOS versions in a great place, this is something we'd look at building.

Name: Autocomplete to Google Contact Groups (Labels)
Description: Support autocompletion suggestions to Google Contact Groups (when Google Contacts is connected.)

Name: Export message to PDF
Description: Easily export a message to PDF format

Name: Text and background color pickers in the format bar
Description: When composing a message  you can now click on the text color well and select a color from the resulting popover to draw attention to specific text. You can also use the text background color well in the format bar to simulate highlighting of text.

Name: Preference for Menu Extra
Description: Preference to show a menu extra with an unread count  and menu to open the main window or compose a new message.

Name: Support Plugins / Add-Ons
Description: Develop a plugin API to enable development of plugins for Mimestream. Let us know what services you'd want to integrate with!

Name: Autocomplete from Google Contacts
Description: Support autocompleting addresses from your Google Contacts. Although Mimestream already integrates with the Apple Contacts app  where you can already add your Google account. However, direct integration within the app would allow for a greater degree of separation between personal contacts and work contacts.

Name: Option to always load images for a sender
Description: Disabling remote images is a great way to protect your privacy  but it can be tiresome to repeatedly load images. For senders where you are comfortable always loading remote images, it would be useful to have the ability to always load images from them.
